body:
The Court of Protection protects individuals who lack capacity under the Mental Capacity Act.

The Court of Protection makes decisions for financial or welfare matters for people who can’t make decisions at the time they need to be made (they ‘lack mental capacity’). 

The court will decide whether someone has the mental capacity to make a particular decision for themselves.They appoint deputies to make ongoing decisions for people who lack mental capacity.

A deputy is someone who makes decisions on someone's behalf if they lack capacity.

### What you need to do

Use [this form](https://cop-upfront-service-respond.dev.form.service.justice.gov.uk/) to tell the Court of Protection whether you agree or disagree with a property and financial affairs application.

It usually takes about 5 minutes.

You can also [complete the paper form](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/apply-to-be-part-of-court-of-protection-proceedings-form-cop5) and post it to the court.

You have 14 days from the day you were told about the application to complete this form.
heading: How to agree or disagree with a property and financial affairs application
